title: Baseball Vote
question_text:
A high school baseball conference is voting for All-Area players. The players names are omitted to ensure there is no favoritism when selecting the players. The table below lists the top three first-basemen in the conference.
PlayerBats (Hand)Batting AverageHitsHomerunsRuns Batted In (RBIs)
ARight$0.325$$44$$15$$58$
BLeft$0.315$$42$$10$$52$
CRight$0.298$$38$$18$$60$
Which of the following is considered a categorical variable?
solution: Variables in data can be classified into two different types: quantitative or categorical. In this case, there are four quantitative variables: Batting Average, Hits, Homeruns, and Runs batted in. These values all take on a numeric value where we can find an average. There is only one value on the table that can be put into categories or groups. Therefore, the hand that the player bats with is a categorical variable. Choice 'E' is correct.

distractor_explanations.A: Choice 'A' is incorrect. Since the batting average of the player is numeric value, it is a quantitative variable.
distractor_explanations.B: Choice 'B' is incorrect. Since the number of hits the player had is a numeric value, it is a quantitative variable.
distractor_explanations.C: Choice 'C' is incorrect. Since the number of homeruns the player had is a numeric value, it is a quantitative variable.
distractor_explanations.D: Choice 'D' is incorrect. Since the number of runs batted in the player had is a numeric value, it is a quantitative variable.
